Publications

    Alvarez-Solas J. and G. Ramstein. "On the triggering mechanism of Heinrich events". PNAS (in press). 2011.
    Alvarez-Solas J., A. Robinson and C. Ritz. "Can recent ice discharges following the Larsen-B ice-shelf collapse be used to infer the driving mechanisms of millennial-scale variations of the Laurentide ice sheet?" . The Cryosphere Discussions, 2011.
    Banderas R., J. Alvarez-Solas and M. Montoya. "Role of CO2 and Southern Ocean winds in glacial abrupt climate change". Clim. Past. Discuss. 2011
    Alvarez-Solas J., M. Montoya, C. Ritz, G. Ramstein, S. Charbit, C. Dumas, K. Nisancioglu, T. Dokken, and A. Ganopolski. "Heinrich event 1: an example of dynamical ice-sheet reaction to oceanic changes" . Clim. Past Discuss. 7, 1567-1583, 2011
    Alvarez-Solas J., S. Charbit, G. Ramstein, D. Paillard, C. Dumas, C. Ritz, D. M. Roche. "Millennial-scale oscillations in the Southern Ocean in response to atmospheric CO2 increase" . Global and Planetary Change . 0921-8181. 2010
    Alvarez-Solas J., S. Charbit, C.Ritz, D.Paillard, G.Ramstein, C. Dumas. "Links between ocean temperature and iceberg discharge during Heinrich events" . Nature Geoscience. 2010.
    Alvarez-Solas J. "Changements abrupts et variabilité rapide: Une étude basée sur une stratégie de plusieurs modèles" . 2010

Presentations in Meetings and Conferences

    Banderas R., J. Álvarez-Solas and M. Montoya. "The role of Southern Ocean winds, upwelling and CO2 in glacial abrupt climate change". International Union for Quaternary Research (INQUA), 2011.

    Avarez-Solas J., C. Ritz, S. Charbit, C. Dumas, G. Ramstein and M. Montoya. "Modelling the impact of ice shelf dynamics on the drainage of the Laurentide ice sheet during Heinrich Event 1". International Union for Quaternary Research (INQUA), 2011.

    Alvarez-Solas J., M. Montoya, C. Ritz, S. Charbit, G. Ramstein, and C. Dumas. "Simulating the effects of oceanic variability on millennial-scale iceberg discharges: focus on Heinrich events". European Geosciences Union (EGU) General Assembly, 2011.

    R. Banderas, J. Álvarez-Solas and M. Montoya. "Bipolar seesaw control of glacial atlantic overturning". European Geosciences Union (EGU) General Assembly, 2011.

    Alvarez-Solas, J., Montoya M., Ritz C., Charbit S., Ramstein G., Dumas C., Nisancioglu K., Dokken T. and Ganopolski A. "On the triggering mechanism for Heinrich Events". Potsdam International EMICs Workshop. January 2011.

    Alvarez-Solas, J., Montoya M., Ritz C., Charbit S., Ramstein G. and Dumas C. "Abrupt Climate Change: focus on Heinrich Events". Kyoto Paleoclimate Modelling Intercomparison Project Phase III (PMIP3) Workshop. December 2010.

    Alvarez-Solas J., M. Montoya, K. Nisancioglu and T. Dokken. "Heinrich event 1 triggered through warmer Nordic subsurface waters". European Geosciences Union (EGU) General Assembly, 2010.

    Alvarez-Solas J. "Climate versus Meteorology". NICE spring school on communicating climate science to the media, France. 2010.

    Alvarez-Solas J., S. Charbit, G. Ramstein, D. Paillard. "Modeling climate millennial-scale variability of the last glacial period". Network for Ice sheet and Climate Evolution (NICE meeting), Bristol. 2009.

    Alvarez-Solas J., G. Ramstein and C. Ritz. "A new mechanism for Heinrich events: Role of the feedbacks between ice streams, ice shelves and ocean from a conceptual model to a 3D ice sheet model". European Geosciences Union (EGU) General Assembly, 2009.

    Avarez-Solas J., C. Ritz, S. Charbit, C. Dumas and G. Ramstein. "Are Heinrich events triggered by the ocean? From a conceptual model to a 3D ice sheet mode". Abstracts Eos Trans. AGU, Fall Meet. Suppl. San Francisco. 2009.

    Alvarez-Solas J. and G. Ramstein. "Millennial-scale abrupt variability in the Southern Ocean as a response to increased atmospheric CO2 in the future". Climate Modeling meeting at the University of Tokyo. 2008.

    Alvarez-Solas J., C. Ritz, S. Charbit and G. Ramstein. "Investigating the conditions for large ice-sheet instabilities". European Geosciences Union (EGU) General Assembly, 2008.
